pysketcher.curve module¶

class pysketcher.curve.Curve(points: List[pysketcher.point.Point])[source]¶

Bases: pysketcher.shape.Shape

General curve as a sequence of (x,y) coordintes.

deform(displacement_function)[source]¶

Displace all coordinates according to displacement_function(x,y).

draw(drawing_tool: pysketcher.drawing_tool.DrawingTool)[source]¶

Send the curve to the plotting engine. That is, convert coordinate information in self.x and self.y, together with optional settings of linestyles, etc., to plotting commands for the chosen engine.

minmax_coordinates(minmax=None)[source]¶
property points¶
rotate(angle: float, center: pysketcher.point.Point) → pysketcher.curve.Curve[source]¶

Rotate all coordinates: angle is measured in radians center is the “origin” of the rotation.

scale(factor: float) → pysketcher.curve.Curve[source]¶

Scale all coordinates by factor: x = factor*x, etc.

translate(vec) → pysketcher.curve.Curve[source]¶

Translate all coordinates by a vector vec.

property xs¶
property ys¶

pysketcher.distance_with_text module¶

class pysketcher.distance_with_text.DistanceWithText(text: str, start: pysketcher.point.Point, end: pysketcher.point.Point, spacing: float = 0.3333333333333333, text_position: pysketcher.distance_with_text.DistanceWithText.TextPosition = <TextPosition.MIDDLE: 2>)[source]¶

Bases: pysketcher.composition.ShapeWithText

Arrow <-> with text (usually a symbol) at the midpoint, used for identifying a some distance in a figure. The text is placed slightly to the right of vertical-like arrows, with text displaced text_spacing times to total distance in x direction of the plot area. The text is by default aligned ‘left’ in this case. For horizontal-like arrows, the text is placed the same distance above, but aligned ‘center’ by default (when alignment is None).

class TextPosition(value)[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

An enumeration.

END = 3¶
MIDDLE = 2¶
START = 1¶
swap() → TextPosition[source]¶

pysketcher.matplotlibdraw module¶

class pysketcher.matplotlibdraw.MatplotlibDraw(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, axis=False, new_figure=True)[source]¶

Bases: pysketcher.drawing_tool.DrawingTool

Simple interface for plotting. This interface makes use of Matplotlib for plotting.

Some attributes that must be controlled directly (no set_* method since these attributes are changed quite seldom).

Attribute

Description

allow_screen_graphics

False means that no plot is shown on the screen. (Does not work yet.)

arrow_head_width

Size of arrow head.
arrow2(x, y, dx, dy, style='->')[source]¶

Draw arrow (dx,dy) at (x,y). style is ‘->’, ‘<-‘ or ‘<->’.

display(title=None, show=True)[source]¶

Display the figure.

erase()[source]¶

Erase the current figure.

inside(point: pysketcher.point.Point)[source]¶
inside_plot_area(points: List[pysketcher.point.Point], verbose=True)[source]¶

Check that all coordinates are within drawing_tool’s area.

ok()[source]¶

Return True if set_coordinate_system is called and objects can be drawn.

plot_curve(points: List[pysketcher.point.Point], style: pysketcher.style.Style)[source]¶

Draw a curve with coordinates x and y (arrays).

savefig(filename, dpi=None, crop=True)[source]¶

Save figure in file. Set dpi=300 for really high resolution.

set_grid(on=False)[source]¶
text(text: str, position: pysketcher.point.Point, direction: pysketcher.point.Point = (1.000000, 0.000000), style: pysketcher.style.TextStyle = <pysketcher.style.TextStyle object>)[source]¶

Write text string at a position (centered, left, right - according to the alignment string). position is a point in the coordinate system. If arrow+tip != None, an arrow is drawn from the text to a point (on a curve, for instance). The arrow_tip argument is then the (x,y) coordinates for the arrow tip. fontsize=0 indicates use of the default font as set by set_fontsize.

Description

pysketcher.shape module¶

class pysketcher.shape.Shape[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Superclass for drawing different geometric shapes. Subclasses define shapes, but drawing, rotation, translation, etc. are done in generic functions in this superclass.

animate(drawing_tool: pysketcher.drawing_tool.DrawingTool, time_points: List[float], action: Callable[[Shape, float, float], Shape], pause_per_frame: float = 0.5, dt: float = 0.5, title=None)[source]¶

pysketcher.text module¶

class pysketcher.text.Text(text: str, position: pysketcher.point.Point, direction: pysketcher.point.Point = 1.0, 0.0)[source]¶

Bases: pysketcher.shape.Shape

Place text at the (x,y) point position, with the given fontsize (0 indicates that the default fontsize set in drawing_tool is to be used). The text is centered around position if alignment is ‘center’; if ‘left’, the text starts at position, and if ‘right’, the right and of the text is located at position.

draw(drawing_tool: pysketcher.drawing_tool.DrawingTool, verbose=0)[source]¶
rotate(angle: float, center: pysketcher.point.Point)[source]¶
set_alignment(alignment: pysketcher.style.TextStyle.Alignment) → pysketcher.text.Text[source]¶
property style¶

pysketcher.uniform_load module¶

class pysketcher.uniform_load.UniformLoad(lower_left_corner: pysketcher.point.Point, width: float, height: float, num_arrows=10)[source]¶

Bases: pysketcher.composition.Composition

Downward-pointing arrows indicating a vertical load. The arrows are of equal length and filling a rectangle specified as in the Rectangle class.

Recorded geometric features:

Attribute

Description

mid_top

Middle point at the top of the row of arrows (often used for positioning a text).
geometric_features()[source]¶
